steps.text: Open the incident in Datadog to check graphs for error rate, latency, and impacted endpoints. If the error rate exceeds the baseline for more than five minutes, treat it as a real incident.
Open logs in Kibana filtered by service name and error code. Scan for recent stack traces and note patterns like timeouts, database errors, or bad configurations.
Create a Jira incident ticket using the "Incident" template. Include the alert link, suspected root cause, and impacted customers or features.
Share the ticket link and a summary in the #incidents Slack channel. Assign an incident commander if one is not already assigned.
Update the ticket with any immediate mitigation steps taken, such as rollbacks or scaling adjustments, to provide full context.
